body_html:
Quick update:
I removed the following lines and it worked!

        variable_averages = tf.train.ExponentialMovingAverage( args.decay_factor, global_step)
        variables_averages_op = variable_averages.apply(tf.trainable_variables())

I'm not sure why, but I suspect it has somehting to do with the variables that ExponentialMovingAverage creates, per the docs:

Creates a new ExponentialMovingAverage object.

The `apply()` method has to be called to create shadow variables and add
ops to maintain moving averages.

body:
Quick update: 
I removed the following lines and it worked! 
```
        variable_averages = tf.train.ExponentialMovingAverage( args.decay_factor, global_step)
        variables_averages_op = variable_averages.apply(tf.trainable_variables())

```
I'm not sure why, but I suspect it has somehting to do with the variables that ExponentialMovingAverage creates, per the docs:

> Creates a new ExponentialMovingAverage object.
> 
>     The `apply()` method has to be called to create shadow variables and add
>     ops to maintain moving averages.
>
